de.galgtonold.jollydayandroid

Class HolidayManager

  • java.lang.Object
    • de.galgtonold.jollydayandroid.HolidayManager
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    XMLManager

    public abstract class HolidayManager
extends java.lang.Object
    Abstract base class for all holiday manager implementations. Upon call of getInstance method the implementing class will be read from the jollyday.properties file and instantiated.

      Utility for calendar operations

      • getInstance

        public static final HolidayManager getInstance(java.util.Properties properties)
        Returns a HolidayManager instance by calling getInstance(NULL, Properties) and thus using the default locales country code and the provided configuration properties.
        Parameters:
        properties - configuration properties to use
        Returns:
        default locales HolidayManager

      • getInstance

        public static final HolidayManager getInstance(java.lang.String calendar)
        Creates an HolidayManager instance. The implementing HolidayManager class will be read from the jollyday.properties file. If the calendar is NULL or an empty string the default locales country code will be used.
        Parameters:
        calendar - a String object.
        Returns:
        HolidayManager implementation for the provided country.

      • getInstance

        public static final HolidayManager getInstance(java.lang.String calendar,
                                               java.util.Properties properties)
        Creates an HolidayManager instance. The implementing HolidayManager class will be read from the configuration properties. If the calendar is NULL or an empty string the default locales country code will be used.
        Parameters:
        properties - the configuration properties
        calendar - a String object.
        Returns:
        HolidayManager implementation for the provided country.

      • getInstance

        public static final HolidayManager getInstance(java.net.URL url)
        Creates an HolidayManager instance. The implementing HolidayManager class will be read from the jollyday.properties file. If the URL is NULL an exception will be thrown.
        Parameters:
        url - the URL to the calendar's file
        Returns:
        HolidayManager implementation for the provided country.

      • getInstance

        public static final HolidayManager getInstance(java.net.URL url,
                                               java.util.Properties properties)
        Creates an HolidayManager instance. The implementing HolidayManager class will be read from the jollyday.properties file. If the URL is NULL an exception will be thrown.
        Parameters:
        properties - the configuration properties
        url - the URL to the calendar's file
        Returns:
        HolidayManager implementation for the provided country.

      • setManagerCachingEnabled

        public static void setManagerCachingEnabled(boolean managerCachingEnabled)
        If true, instantiated managers will be cached. If false every call to getInstance will create new manager. True by default.
        Parameters:
        managerCachingEnabled - the managerCachingEnabled to set

      • isManagerCachingEnabled

        public static boolean isManagerCachingEnabled()

        isManagerCachingEnabled.

        Returns:
        the managerCachingEnabled

      • clearManagerCache

        public static void clearManagerCache()
        Clears the manager cache from all cached manager instances.

      • isHoliday

        public boolean isHoliday(org.joda.time.LocalDate c,
                         java.lang.String... args)
        Show if the requested date is a holiday.
        Parameters:
        c - The potential holiday.
        args - Hierarchy to request the holidays for. i.e. args = {'ny'} -> New York holidays
        Returns:
        is a holiday in the state/region

      • getHolidays

        public abstract java.util.Set<Holiday> getHolidays(int year,
                                                   java.lang.String... args)
        Returns the holidays for the requested year and hierarchy structure.
        Parameters:
        year - i.e. 2010
        args - i.e. args = {'ny'}. returns US/New York holidays. No args -> holidays common to whole country
        Returns:
        the list of holidays for the requested year

      • getHolidays

        public abstract java.util.Set<Holiday> getHolidays(org.joda.time.ReadableInterval interval,
                                                   java.lang.String... args)
        Returns the holidays for the requested interval and hierarchy structure.
        Parameters:
        interval - the interval in which the holidays lie.
        args - a String object.
        Returns:
        list of holidays within the interval

      • init

        public abstract void init(java.lang.String calendar)
        Initializes the implementing manager for the provided calendar.
        Parameters:
        calendar - i.e. us, uk, de

      • init

        public abstract void init(java.net.URL resource)
        Initializes the implementing manager for the provided URL.
        Parameters:
        resource - the URL, to a file containing the calendar

        Note 1: This can be omitted, in which case the default behavior of loading from the classpath with a specific name will be used

        Note 2: If this parameter is not omitted, then it may be a path to a file (relative or absolute) or a URL spec (such as http://somehos/somefile, or ftp://somehost/somefile or whatever is supported by the URL Stream Handlers installed on the JVM)

      • getCalendarHierarchy

        public abstract CalendarHierarchy getCalendarHierarchy()
        Returns the configured hierarchy structure for the specific manager. This hierarchy shows how the configured holidays are structured and can be retrieved.
        Returns:
        Current calendars hierarchy
